skill.name: SEO Fundamentals
skill.description: Auto-invoke when reviewing HTML head, meta tags, or Next.js page components. Enforces semantic HTML and search optimization.
skill.summary: Auto-invoke when reviewing HTML head, meta tags, or Next.js page components. Enforces semantic HTML ...
skill.author: DanielPodolsky

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and checklists. No code execution, file access, network calls, or command execution. Contains SEO guidelines and examples only.

content.value_statement: Developers often miss critical SEO elements or use incorrect HTML semantics. This skill systematically reviews web pages for title tags, meta descriptions, heading hierarchy, and semantic HTML to improve search visibility.
actual_capabilities: Reviews HTML head sections for missing title and meta description tags
Checks heading hierarchy (H1 to H6) for proper structure
Validates semantic HTML elements (header, main, nav, article, footer)
Verifies image alt text for accessibility and SEO
Reviews Open Graph and Twitter Card meta tags
Examines canonical URLs and structured data (JSON-LD)
limitations: Does not modify code automatically - provides recommendations only
Does not crawl live websites or fetch live pages
Does not perform Core Web Vitals measurements
Does not integrate with external SEO tools or APIs

use_cases.title: Review Page SEO
use_cases.description: Review component code for proper meta tags, semantic HTML, and accessibility attributes before deployment.

use_cases.title: Next.js SEO Audit
use_cases.description: Audit Next.js pages for metadata exports, Open Graph tags, and proper heading structure.

use_cases.title: Verify Index Readiness
use_cases.description: Ensure landing pages include all required SEO elements for search engine indexing.

prompt_templates.title: Basic SEO Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this page code for SEO issues. Check title tag, meta description, heading hierarchy, and image alt text.

prompt_templates.title: Semantic HTML Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Does this HTML use semantic elements correctly? Identify any div soup or missing semantic tags.

prompt_templates.title: Social Media Tags
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the Open Graph and Twitter Card implementation. Are all required tags present?

prompt_templates.title: Complete SEO Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete SEO audit of this Next.js page component. Include metadata, semantic HTML, and accessibility checks.

output_examples.input: Review this page for SEO issues
output: Found 2 issues: Missing meta description, Multiple H1 tags (found 3)
‚úì Title tag present (55 chars - good length)
Recommendation: Add meta description with 150-160 characters
Recommendation: Keep only one H1, use H2 for section headings

best_practices: Include unique title tag (50-60 chars) and meta description (150-160 chars) on every page
Use one H1 per page with logical heading hierarchy (H1 ‚Üí H2 ‚Üí H3, no skipping)
Replace div containers with semantic HTML elements (nav, main, article, aside, footer)
Add descriptive alt text to all images explaining what the image conveys
anti_patterns: Multiple H1 tags on a single page - confuses search engines about page hierarchy
Empty or generic alt text like 'image1.jpg' - loses accessibility and SEO value
Using div elements instead of semantic HTML - prevents screen reader navigation
Skipping heading levels (H1 to H4) - breaks document outline for assistive technologies

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for automated SEO review during development.

faq.question: What character limits should I follow?
faq.answer: Title tags: 50-60 characters. Meta descriptions: 150-160 characters. Both prevent truncation in search results.

faq.question: Does this integrate with SEO tools?
faq.answer: No. This skill reviews code during development. Use dedicated SEO tools like Google Search Console for production monitoring.

faq.question: Is user data collected?
faq.answer: No. This skill only reviews code locally. No data is transmitted externally or stored.

faq.question: Why is semantic HTML important for SEO?
faq.answer: Search engines and screen readers use semantic elements to understand page structure. Proper HTML improves accessibility and rankings.

faq.question: How is this different from linters?
faq.answer: Linters catch syntax errors. This skill reviews SEO strategy, content quality, and semantic structure choices that require human judgment.
